title: Civil War Events Quiz
description: Test your recall of the key events and figures of the American Civil War!

questions.question: Which battle is considered the turning point of the American Civil War?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Gettysburg (July 1-3, 1863) was a decisive Union victory that ended Confederate General Lee's invasion of the North.

questions.question: What document did President Lincoln issue on January 1, 1863, freeing enslaved people in Confederate states?
questions.explanation: The Emancipation Proclamation declared all enslaved people in Confederate territory to be free, transforming the war into a fight for freedom.

questions.question: Where was the first shot of the Civil War fired in April 1861?
questions.explanation: Confederate forces fired on Fort Sumter in Charleston Harbor, South Carolina on April 12, 1861, beginning the American Civil War.

questions.question: Who was the President of the Confederate States of America?
questions.explanation: Jefferson Davis served as the President of the Confederate States of America from 1861 until the end of the war in 1865.

questions.question: Which Union general's 'March to the Sea' devastated Georgia in 1864?
questions.explanation: General William Tecumseh Sherman led his famous March to the Sea from Atlanta to Savannah in November-December 1864, destroying Confederate resources.

questions.question: Where did Robert E. Lee surrender to Ulysses S. Grant, effectively ending the Civil War?
questions.explanation: Lee surrendered to Grant at Appomattox Court House, Virginia on April 9, 1865, effectively ending the American Civil War.

questions.question: Which battle was the bloodiest single-day battle in American history?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Antietam (Sharpsburg) on September 17, 1862, resulted in approximately 23,000 casualties, making it the bloodiest single day in American military history.

questions.question: Which Confederate general was accidentally shot by his own troops at the Battle of Chancellorsville?
questions.explanation: General Thomas 'Stonewall' Jackson was accidentally shot by Confederate soldiers at Chancellorsville in May 1863 and died eight days later.

questions.question: What famous speech did Lincoln deliver at the dedication of a military cemetery in 1863?
questions.explanation: Lincoln delivered the Gettysburg Address on November 19, 1863, a brief but powerful speech redefining the war as a struggle for equality.

questions.question: Which ironclad warships fought the first battle between armored ships in 1862?
questions.explanation: The USS Monitor and CSS Virginia (formerly USS Merrimack) fought at Hampton Roads on March 9, 1862, the first battle between ironclad warships.

questions.question: Where was Abraham Lincoln assassinated?
questions.explanation: President Lincoln was shot by John Wilkes Booth at Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C. on April 14, 1865, and died the following morning.

questions.question: Which amendment to the Constitution formally abolished slavery?
questions.explanation: The 13th Amendment, ratified on December 6, 1865, formally abolished slavery throughout the United States.

questions.question: What was the name of the 54th Massachusetts Infantry, one of the first African American regiments?
questions.explanation: The 54th Massachusetts was one of the first African American regiments in the Union Army, famous for their courageous assault on Fort Wagner in July 1863.

questions.question: Which Union victory in 1863 gave the North control of the Mississippi River?
questions.explanation: The Siege of Vicksburg ended on July 4, 1863, giving the Union complete control of the Mississippi River and splitting the Confederacy in two.

questions.question: How many states seceded from the Union to form the Confederacy?
questions.explanation: Eleven states seceded from the Union between December 1860 and June 1861 to form the Confederate States of America.
